channel.title: My Java Game
channel.description:
The following are all the archived copies of my first edition:
http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070623031010src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070624175818src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070624175825src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070624193107src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070624205802src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070625021234src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070625030123src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070625033910src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070626140223src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070626223624src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070627005230src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070627172508src.zip
And here are some pictures of it in development:
[img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/9053/pic1ff4.jpg[/img]
[img]http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070715144403pic2.jpg[/img]
[img]http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070715144446pic.jpg[/img]
[img]http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070715144534Untitled5.jpg[/img]
Here are some downloads of edition 2:
http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070704022352new%20src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070706034740new%20src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070710173751new%20src.zip http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070711022451new%20src.zip Newest upload: http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070715145848new%20src.zip
And some pictures:
Working multiplayer: [img]http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070715144637fight_arena1.bmp[/img]
Working multi-chat: [img]http://downloads.ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/uploads/20070715145101fight_arena2.bmp[/img]
After getting this far, I think I am going to do another rewrite that is an Applet, and it is 100% dependent on the server for everything. It won't even be using a cache.

item.title: My Java Game
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:71, topic:115614”]Mod Taharok, it really isn’t difficult to write the bytes.
You actually have a fair few options available to you. If you’re lazy, why don’t you make the ‘Tile’ class serializable? Then you can just:

while(in.available() != 0) { whateverDataStructure.add(in.readObject()); }
Or you could just use a DataInputStream and use the nice convenience methods:

readByte()
readShort()
readInt()
readLong()
readDouble()
readUTF()
etc...

I don’t really see how there can be any trouble if you use either of those methods - it can’t get any simpler.[/quote]

Ooo I always program basic server client applications using DataOutputStreams and DataInputStreams.

Read full topic

item.title: My Java Game
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:71, topic:115614”]Mod Taharok, it really isn’t difficult to write the bytes.
You actually have a fair few options available to you. If you’re lazy, why don’t you make the ‘Tile’ class serializable? Then you can just:

while(in.available() != 0) { whateverDataStructure.add(in.readObject()); }
Or you could just use a DataInputStream and use the nice convenience methods:

readByte()
readShort()
readInt()
readLong()
readDouble()
readUTF()
etc...

I don’t really see how there can be any trouble if you use either of those methods - it can’t get any simpler.[/quote]

The thing is, since a byte cannot exceed the size of 255, I run into problems storing the X and Y coordinates since they are larger than that. So I came up with a few different storage plans, but the whole thing becomes complicated in my mind… :o

Read full topic

item.title: My Java Game
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Mod Taharok, it really isn’t difficult to write the bytes.
You actually have a fair few options available to you. If you’re lazy, why don’t you make the ‘Tile’ class serializable? Then you can just:

while(in.available() != 0) { whateverDataStructure.add(in.readObject()); }
Or you could just use a DataInputStream and use the nice convenience methods:

readByte()
readShort()
readInt()
readLong()
readDouble()
readUTF()
etc...

I don’t really see how there can be any trouble if you use either of those methods - it can’t get any simpler.

Read full topic

item.title: My Java Game
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“RLN, post:66, topic:115614”][quote author=I Am Olan14 link=topic=164886.msg1626423#msg1626423 date=1185334722]

Sry to be the noob MT but I need you to explain how your map1.dat is read… I need to make my map peices… for now ill just but a lot of tiles so it loooks like something

It stores simply as

tile[space]=[space](tileID)[tab](tileX)[tab](tileY)[tab](useless(madatory)crap)

And is read starting on Y row 1, X tile 1, and loads all the X tiles on Y row 1 until it finishes. Then it repeats on Y row 2 and loops through all the Y rows until the map is constructed.

are you stupid? why would you store it as strings? just write the bytes

I tried storing it as bytes, but I had a lot of troubles when doing so. I will be definitely doing that later though.

See, Mod Taharok is smart.
[/quote]Yeah, he proved that by failing to read bytes from a stream[/quote]

Nah, I did successfully read the bytes. My pattern didn’t write properly or something of the sort.

Read full topic

And is read starting on Y row 1, X tile 1, and loads all the X tiles on Y row 1 until it finishes. Then it repeats on Y row 2 and loops through all the Y rows until the map is constructed.

are you stupid? why would you store it as strings? just write the bytes

I tried storing it as bytes, but I had a lot of troubles when doing so. I will be definitely doing that later though.
[/quote]

See, Mod Taharok is smart.[/quote]Yeah, he proved that by failing to read bytes from a stream

item.title: My Java Game
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

pizza pie:

Sry to be the noob MT but I need you to explain how your map1.dat is read… I need to make my map peices… for now ill just but a lot of tiles so it loooks like something

It stores simply as

tile[space]=[space](tileID)[tab](tileX)[tab](tileY)[tab](useless(madatory)crap)

And is read starting on Y row 1, X tile 1, and loads all the X tiles on Y row 1 until it finishes. Then it repeats on Y row 2 and loops through all the Y rows until the map is constructed.
